title: Why does so many people on YouTube pronounce it "Spear of 'So'jin"?
body:
Am I missing something? It's spelt 'Shojin' yet like, I keep coming across a weirdly large amount of people pronounce it 'Sojin' all over YouTube..

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

replies.body: why are you watching people play league on youtube?

> [{quoted}](name=BLACK REALM GOD,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=bslW7JoX,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-04-04T03:44:45.268+0000)
>
> why are you watching people play league on youtube?

I don't really watch people 'play' per se, I'd say out of what I watch about LoL on YouTube, 90% of it is learning material such as guides, builds, tips and tricks, tier lists etc. and the remaining 10% are montages. I never ever watch full gameplays for example (unless it's Worlds which I'd say is a pretty reasonable exception)

> [{quoted}](name=Jinto,realm=OCE,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=bslW7JoX,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-04-04T11:46:29.262+0000)
>
> I don't really watch people 'play' per se, I'd say out of what I watch about LoL on YouTube, 90% of it is learning material such as guides, builds, tips and tricks, tier lists etc. and the remaining 10% are montages. I never ever watch full gameplays for example (unless it's Worlds which I'd say is a pretty reasonable exception)

i enjoy watching the animations and stuff that people make.

> [{quoted}](name=BLACK REALM GOD,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=bslW7JoX,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-04-04T22:08:07.853+0000)
>
> i enjoy watching the animations and stuff that people make.

I will forever have a soft spot for Stick Figure Spotlights 1 to 5, in fact my brother showed me the first one and told me "the more you play the more you'll understand". That was back in 2012 and has stuck with me ever since.

> [{quoted}](name=Jinto,realm=OCE,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=bslW7JoX,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2019-04-05T00:42:55.977+0000)
>
> I will forever have a soft spot for Stick Figure Spotlights 1 to 5, in fact my brother showed me the first one and told me "the more you play the more you'll understand". That was back in 2012 and has stuck with me ever since.

it's amusing how accurate those animations were and how much detail could be displayed by a simple stick figure with the right props
Can't pronounce it properly, yet they pronounce "sure" as sh-ur instead of s-ur.
"Am I missing something?"  Not really. Even for really simple things, it's just... people don't try.
